tagDescription: General T.Cadwalader to Baring Bros. & Co. Proposes a joint purchase of Bank United States shares.

E.Chauncey, Cashier of the Bank of Pennsylvania to Baring Bros. & Co. Has been instructed by the President and Directors of the Bank to request their agency in placing Pennsylvania Stock on the European markets.
A.H. Dorr to J. Bates - informing him that he has commenced the brokerage of stocks, loans and Exchange, in New York &c.
Gowan & Marx to Baring Bros. & Co. Enclosing copy of Letter to Messrs Joseph Marx & Son, Richmond, Virginia, relating to a loan contemplated by the State of Virginia.
Cochran & Robertson, Lima, to Baring Bros. & Co. Affairs of Peru.
John Richards to Baring Bros. & Co. Relative to Jersey property. (See 15 Sept.1825). The cotton market &c.
T.H.Perkins to J.Bates. Discusses European affairs. Compares their cotton manufactures with English ones &c.
James Barbour to Joshua Bates - Re political difficulties of the United States - the Tariff, the Georgia question, the Bank & c.
Israel Munsen: The watch is not up to expectation; Enclosed is letter of introduction from Sam Dow to Wm. Bond who goes to London procure another watch.
Sam Cabot: Schedule and advice to ship cargoes.
Henry G. Chapman: arrangement for chains cannot take place.
Cochran & Robertson, Lima, to Baring Bros. & Co. Re their claim against the firm.
[Thos.Duguid] to Baring Bros. & Co. Re business transactions with their House.
Le Roy, Bayard & Co. to Baring Bros. & Co. Re arrival of Mr McPherson, the American Consul of Cathagena, in London, after the defeat of the Spanish army in Peru.
Richard Willing: Offer to market $200,000 bonds on account of bank of Pennsylvania.
Silas E. Burrows to Baring Bros. & Co. - remarks upon President's Message & Bank of the United States.
J.S.Lake to A.Baring. Re Miss West and Mrs Kirkby's case against Mr Walker of the House of Baring.
M.E. Gorostiza: Business matters (in Spanish).
Thos. Cotterell to Baring Bros. & Co. Enclosing extract of a letter from New Orleans on the Banks and the felly of creating new ones.
Zimmermann, Frazier & Co., short supply of merchandise; speculation in beef. Departure of the American charge d'affaires widens the breach between the two countries. Financial affairs
Davis & Brooks to Baring Bros. & Co. asking their friendly offices for Mr. Chas. Brooks who goes to Europe as their agent.
List of Escritures belonging to Francis Baring deposited in the hands of T.R.Poinsett &c. N.W.& D. (Nolte,Wilson & Drake).
J.Deacon to S.C.Holland. His remarks on settlement of American Stocks.
Treasury Department. Statement showing the amount of the several stocks, held by domestic and foreign creditors on the 15 Oct.1828
Horace Gray: Inquiry about numbers on bond notes.
Jonathan Amory: Montgomery, Smith & Amory offers services as agent.
Silas E. Burrows: Rechartering of the U.S. Bank of Pennsylvania and other states considered favourable.
R.R. Hunter Cowes to J. Bates - Personal matters.
Robert R. Hunter: Departure for the U.S.A. Business matters.
Silas E. Burrows to Baring Bros. & Co. on United States Bank affairs.
Henry G, Chapman: Enclosing letter from Sam Hubbard of 13 March 1833 about consignment of goods.
William Duguid to S.C.Holland. Enclosing extract of Letter from his brother, Thomas Duguid under date the 24th of October giving his opinion on the existing government of Buenos Ayres.
Chas.Wilkes, President, Bank of New York to Baring Bros. & Co. Re proposal to delay the payment of one half of the debt.
John Ferguson to Baring Bros. & Co., respecting Louisiana Bonds &c.
Silas E. Burrows to Baring Bros. & Co. Re transfer to them of United States Bank Stock standing in their name - Bank affairs &c.
Wm Tucker: Simon Willard desires to obtain agency of manufacturers of chronometers.
F.B. Ogden, question of presentation of Date Bills for acceptance.
Sam Cabot: Attempt to sell Rose's cargo unsuccessful. Advises to withhold the sale of second cargo to obtain good price.
Sam Russell: No prospect of renewal of the monopoly of the East India Company in China trade. Urges to join forces in establishing trade with China.
Daniel Lang: Loading freight for Canton.
Joshua Bates to Bryant Sturgis & Co.: Refers to East India operation. (Faded press copy).
Hermann Nolte to Baring Bros. & Co. Mexican Affairs.
T. Cadwalader to Baring Bros. & Co. Comments on the President's Message with reference to the Bank of United States &c.
Le Roy Bayard & Co.: Building of frigates; Business affairs. Enclosures.
Nathan Mitchell & J.B. Toulmin to Baring Bros. & Co. Enclosing plan of charter of proposed bank, to be submitted to Legislature of Alabama (missing)- comments on other Banks in the State.
Sam Cabot: Schedule of ships to carry goods to China; opium trade, shipping schedule in general.
Dr Eric Bollman, Kingston, Jamaica, to Alex.Baring. Interesting description of Jamaica &c - Sketch of Bolivar.
James A. Dickson to J. Bates - Re Loan on the Stock of the Atlas Bank, Boston.
George Marx to J. Bates, on Louisiana Loan.
General T.Cadwalader: The Bank declared dividend.
Felix Castro: Sale of Buenos Ayres Stock.
P. Dalmahoy, consignment of cotton.
Freshfield, Kaye & Freshfield. Formation of an Association for the project of effecting a junction between the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans. Filed with this is copy of Instructions for a contract.
Rob. Robertson to A.Baring M.P. on Affairs of Spanish Colonies.
Russell Sturgis: Operating ships between London and New York.
F. Macaulay, President of N. Carolina Co., to J. Bates. Comments on reference to Bank of United States in the President's Message - Gold refining proposition.
Horace Gray to J. Bates - claims that promises made to him of extended commission business by Mr. Ward have not been fulfilled.
H.Lavergne to Baring Bros. & Co. Re formation of the "Consolidated Association of the Planters of "Louisiana"
Richard Willing to Francis Baring. Relative to papers of Nolte.
S. Cock to J. Bates: With regard to the importation of Tea in Bond from the United States.
H.M. Labouchere to Baring Bros. & Co. Re an investment in cotton with his house.
Thos. Cotterill: Louisiana State Bonds.
John Parker to Baring Bros. & Co. Re failure of Crowder, Clough & Co.
Bank of Louisiana State Bonds. Also undated memo setting forth the term of the $7,000,000. loan.
Sam Comly: Expects favourable results under the new tariff. Reference to Mr. Scott.
Sam Cabot: Shipping schedule.
S. Cabot to Joshua Bates suggesting that agencies be opened for trade in China and India & Co.
Mark Richards to Baring Bros. & Co. Respecting Loan for the Philadelphia, Germantown & Norristown Railroad Co.
Le Roy, Bayard & Co. to Baring Bros. & Co. Their business affairs.
Gowan & Marx: Louisiana Loan
John Cryder to Baring Bros. & Co. on the subject of advances for Messrs. Alsop & Co.
John Cryder to Baring Bros. & Co. Submitting enquiry in regard to advances on shipments to Alsop and Co.
"A Friend" to Baring Bros. & Co. - Warning them against stock of the Morris Canal & Banking Co. about to be put on the market by Mr. Brooks.
George Knight, Havana, to Joshua Bates. Re transactions at that port.
Robert R. Hunter: Chartering the Brig Baltimore for New York.
John Cryder: Description of a ship.
Lord Howick, Downing Street, to Baring Bros. & Co. Re the establishment of a new Judicature in British Guiana.
Le Roy Bayard & Co.: Ships being built almost completed.
A. Howard to J. Bates - Personal affairs; interesting description of Temple Place, Boston.
J.M.Roxas: Political and Economic conditions: Credit restrictions. Turmoil.
Silas E. Burrows: Forecasts the death of President of the U.S.A. because of ill health. The stock of U.S. Bank would advance in such event.
L.Baldwin to Joshua Bates. Introducing his brother who is about to visit England.
Richard C. Derby: Death of wife and departure for Europe.
E.G. Oelrichs to S.C.Holland. Introducing Mr W.S.Ringgold to their House.
Gowan & Marx to Baring Bros. & Co. Re contemplated United States Loan. Rumoured instructions to Bank of United States.
N. Niles: Departure for the United States.
Wm. Sturgis & Co., trade with Canton; advise when and how to ship goods.

Ch. Latham & Co. to Baring Bros. - Re wheat shipments. Enclosing Havre Prices Current 9 January, 1833. Statement of the general Imports, Outgoings and Stocks of Cottons in France in 1832 compared with those of the ten preceding years.
H. Lee: Shipments of indigo, cotton.
T.W. Ward to S. Jaudon, Cashier Bank United States Bank affairs - Press Copy.
Zimmermann, Frazier & Co. to Baring Bros. & Co. Affairs in Buenos Ayres.
Robert Gilmore & Sons to S.C.Holland. Business arrangements. The Bank of United States &c.
Thos. Cotterill: Louisiana Loan.
Memo. left by Mr. Ward in regard to the three per cent with the Bank United States - Press Copy.
Latham & Co. Letter of credit to Daniel Fox: arrival of ship at Calais.
Thos. Cotterill: Louisiana Loan; plans to write to the TIMES about the loan.
Samuel Comly to Baring Bros. & Co. Giving detailed account of his means.
A.Baring: Consolidated Association of Planters of Louisiana.
Daniel W. Coxe: Proposal to settle outstanding debt.
Statement of the amount of the Public Debt held by Foreign and Domestic creditors.
Thomas Searle to Manning & Marshall, Mexico. Enclosing circular letter of Messrs. Geo. Wildes & Co., 1 Nov. 1831 and asking for recommendation of a House for the negotiation of their bills.
H.Lavergne: Petition to the Legislature of Louisiana for the Extension of time on Louisiana Bonds. (Petition missing).
Vicente Rocafuerte: About a treaty of commerce and navigation (in spanish).
Grant, Balfour & Co. to Baring Bros. & Co. Contract for the supply of Leaf Tobacco.
Geo. Knight, Havana, to J. Bates - The sugar and coffee market.
J.M.Roxas. Credit restrictions. Unsettled political and economic conditions.
Backus Casamajor & King: Remittance for investment by the Governor of Cuba.
J.M. Forbes: Government policy in respect to shipping trade from foreign countries. Policy of ship building, registry. Reciprocal laws in England and the United States.
Thomas Duguid to Baring Bros. & Co. South American affairs - military and political.
Silas E. Burrows: Affairs of the U.S. Bank prosperous.
Samuel Russell to Baring Bros. & Co. Respecting possible joint operations in the China trade.
J.A.Brush, Bogota, to J.D.Bunch. South American affairs.
Charles Thorndike to J. Bates. Private instructions re cargo of Smyrna wool shipped to Baring Bros. & Co.
Gowan & Marx: Louisiana Loan.
J. Thomson, Bonar & Co. to Baring Bros. & Co. Enclosing copy of order for copper, with calculations thereon sent to the St.Petersburg House
List of Foreign Holders of the 3 per cent on New York Books with the names of their agents.
John Murray: Settlement of Tunno's suit.
Geo. Knight, Havana, to J. Bates - Enclosing copy of letter of 5 June, 1832 giving a detailed account of his business, also proposed changes in it.
Sam Cabot: Disposal of cargo at Le Havre.
J. Sillem, Amsterdam, to Baring Bros. & Co. Plan for remittances on account of American Bank.

Jos. Marryat to S.C.Holland. Offer for the purchase of the Union Estate in St.Lucia to be submitted to the creditors of the Estate of Inglis & Co. N.B. Filed with this are two papers under date of 11 Feb. 1824. Abstract of crop and statement of the Subscribers of the Loan &c to Inglis & Co. for the crop of 1823, both signed Chas.Campbell,Trustee.
Russell Sturgis: Establishment of shipping line between London, Liverpool and New York.
G. Joy: Speculation on stock market; enclosed extract of letter of 5 September 1833 about unrest in Belgium, Poland and Portugal.
Israel Munson to Wm. Bond: More about the watch.
H.Lavergne: Association of the Planters of Louisiana.
Samuel Comly to Baring Bros. & Co. Warns them against a former agent of his, Mr. S. Allinson.
John Murray: about letter from Mr. Tunno's Solicitors.
Official Extract of the Law of the Commonwealth of Virginia, March 8th 1824, authorizing a Loan of Â£4000,000. Peter V.Daniel, Lt. Governor affixed the Great Seal of the State, 7 May 1824.
Silas E. Burrows - speculation on the stock market. Encloses McLane's report.
Sam Cabot: Business affairs.
Silas E. Burrows: The United States Bank stock advances to III on the market. Financial and business affairs.
General T. Cadwalader: Encloses report of the Secretary of the Treasury concerning the 3% Bonds.
Thomson, Bonar & Co: Purchase of copper.
Sam Cabot: Instructions about shipping goods.
Silas E. Burrows to Baring Bros. & Co. Re sales of his United States Bank Stock - His shipping operations - The "John Baring" &c.
Le Roy Bayard & Co.: Cotton; Business in Columbia.
Le Roy, Bayard & Co. to Baring Bros. & Co. The Legislature of Ohio will require a Loan of two million dollars for a canal to join with Lake Erie &c.
J. Thomson, Bonar & Co: Shipment of copper; Enclosed letter from St.Petersburg's Agent of 16 Feb. 1823.
Louis McLane: Refers to arrangements for financing the canal company.
John Bowen to J. Bates - Application for an extension of credit.

T.W. Ward to Prime, Ward, King and Co. Re forwarding to Samuel Jaudon, Cashier of the Bank United States, certificates and powers of the purchased three per cent. Press Copy - Enclosed in 22 January, 1833.
General T. Cadwalader: Postponement of reimbursement to holders of the United States 3% stock.
J.C. Labouchere: about Cathinka's invoice and charges.
T.Baring: Memo on John Walker's land deal and treatment of Miss West and Mrs Kirby; Summary of steps taken 18-20 Sept. 1825.
Horace Binney, Philadelphia. Opinion respecting the Bank of the United States paying the dividend in London.
General T. Cadwalader: Respecting Dutch holder of the United States 3% stock.
Benjamin Sprague: Offer to ply ship between Liverpool and New York.
John Brokenbrough, President Bank of Virginia to Baring Bros. & Co. Making enquiries re a projected Loan of one or two hundred thousand pounds for the Bank.
W.J. Marshall: Selection of Messrs. Parish & Co. as bankers in Hamburg of Manning, Marshall & Co.
McLoskey, Hagan & Co. John Hagan and Thomas Barrett withdrew from the firm.
Unsigned, (Vera Cruz) to Sir Robert Wilson: Putting aside import duties for dividends due to the Mexican Bondholders.
Thos Cotterill, Louisiana Loan.
Statement of the Cotton market
Wm.Parish Robertson (of Buenos Ayres) to Mr Parish of Bath. Extract respecting Buenos Ayres affairs.
R.B. Forbes: request to procure two ladies watches.
Contract with Cadwalader for postponing the payment of the United States 3 per cent.
Sam Russell: Trade with China to be opened to British subjects.
Le Roy Bayard & Co. to Baring Bros. & Co. Notifies them of the failure of Gracie & Son.
Chas.Wilkes to Baring Bros. & Co. Is about to sail for London to negotiate a Loan on account of the Bank [of New York.]
J.S. Hastings, Member of Boston City Council, to Baring Bros. & Co. Making certain enquiries regarding a scheme of his for a projected Boston Loan.
T.& W.Earle & Co.: Letter of Reference to a Commercial House.
James Barbour to J. Bates - Introducing Col. & Mrs. White.
W.Nott & Co.: Request to honour drafts.
J.L. Page: Business affairs.
General T. Cadwalader to Baring Bros. and Co. Re United States 3 per cent, reimbursable on the 1 October 1832 - 2/3ds & 1/3 on 1 January 1833. N.B. List of Proprietors, Amounts, Agents.
Le Roy Bayard & Co.: Business affairs in Columbia.
Thos. Cotterrill: News that $7,000,000 of Louisiana Bonds had been negotiated.
Cyrus Perkins to J. Bates enclosing circular of the firm Stevens, Cromwell & Co. in which his son Francis, has just become a partner.
Abstract of the Funded Debt of the United States.
Manning & Marshall. Tobacco Speculation Account.
J. Adam Smith: Disposal of trunks left by John A. King.
Sam Cabot: Opium trade.
List of New York Houses. Importers of Dry goods &c.
Robert R. Hunter: Purchase of Baltimore at 300 pounds; departure for New York.
General T. Cadwalader: Deferment of reimbursement of a portion of 3% stock. Answer from Baring of 24 August 1832.
Thos.& W.Earle: The failure of Crowder, Clough & Co.
Le Roy Bayard & Co. to Baring Bros. & Co. Detailed account of their business losses &c.
R.Staples & Co. Creditos de la conducta &c. for account of F.Baring Esq.
P. Macaulay, Baltimore, to J. Bates - Re - establishing an assay office in the Gold Region - Political outlook.
John Cryder: Memo of business for Alsop & Co. of Valparaiso and Lima.
Henry G. Chapman: Enclosing account of payments.
Thomson, Bonar & Co.: Purchase of copper.
Alexander Baring to - : Louisiana Loan; Discusses Mr Nolte's position and the best possible procedure for him under the circumstances.
Robert Gilmore & Sons to Baring Bros. & Co. Duplicate letters relative to claims on Smith and Buchanan &c.
Lisa of $750,000 United States three per cent stock - Amount, Name, Address.
W.Nott & Co.: Commission on sales of cotton.
Foreign Holders of three per cents of United States on Pennsylvania Books.
A.H. Dorr to J. Bates: Enclosing circular - Stocks, Banks, Marine Insurance &c.
Power of Attorney to Samuel Jaudon and to Edmund John Forstall, both of New Orleans, from Union Bank of Louisiana, to negotiate the Louisiana Loan Sgd/ M. Morgan, President.
Bryant, Sturgis & Co.: Purchase of opium at Smyrna.
Col. Perkins: China trade; general business news..
Manning & Marshall to Baring Bros. & Co. Mexican financial and military affairs.
Le Roy Bayard & Co.: Columbia contemplates to float a loan in England.
Charles Augustus Davis to J. Bates - Comments on Government policy towards the Bank of United States.
W.Nott & Co.: Confirmation of receipt of drafts.
Manning & Marshall to Baring Bros. & Co. Mexican affairs.
